meanings.definition: A fault that occurs after an event or action.
meanings.sent1: After the game, the coach pointed out the postfault in our defensive strategy.
meanings.sent2: The postfault in the system was only discovered after the project was completed.
meanings.sent3: It was quite a postfault to realize I had been using the wrong ingredients for the recipe.
meanings.sent4: The postfault in communication led to misunderstandings among team members.
meanings.sent5: The postfault in the plan caused delays and confusion.

meanings.definition: To find fault or criticize after the fact.
meanings.sent1: She tends to postfault others instead of offering constructive feedback.
meanings.sent2: It's not helpful to postfault someone for a mistake they made unknowingly.
meanings.sent3: He would always postfault his decisions when things didn't go as planned.
meanings.sent4: Don't just postfault, try to provide solutions for improvement.
meanings.sent5: Postfaulting without understanding the full situation can be unfair.
